form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to ensure that members of the Armed Forces serving on active duty who are diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury have access to hyperbaric oxygen therapy at military medical treatment facilities.

section.header: Provision of hyperbaric oxygen therapy for certain members of the Armed Forces

paragraph.text: Chapter 55 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 1074n the following new section:

section.header: Provision of hyperbaric oxygen therapy for certain members

subsection.text: The Secretary shall furnish hyperbaric oxygen therapy available at a military medical treatment facility to a covered member if such therapy is prescribed by a physician to treat post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury.
In this section, the term covered member means a member of the armed forces who isâ€”

paragraph.text: diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury.
The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 1074n the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 1074o. Provision of hyperbaric oxygen therapy for certain members.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall take effect 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
